newsitem.title: SIERRA LEONE: Sierra Leone police break up banned student demo.
newsitem.headline: Sierra Leone police break up banned student demo.

text.p: Police in Sierra Leone used teargas to break up a rally by more than 2,000 students on Tuesday after the government banned it in a dispute over the venue.
The students called the rally to protest at delays in implementing a peace deal to end a civil war that began in 1991.
The government said the students could hold their rally at the university but banned it in the city centre parade grounds, citing security concerns.
President Ahmad Tejan Kabbah signed a peace deal in Ivory Coast on November 20 with rebel leader Foday Sankoh. Implementation has dragged with each side accusing the other of ceasefire breaches.
